definition[0]: to cut or try to cut something violently with a knife, sword etc
example[1]: The leopard’s claws slashed through the soft flesh.
definition[1]: to greatly reduce an amount, price etc – used especially in newspapers and advertising
example[2]: The workforce has been slashed by 50%.
definition[2]: a quick movement that you make with a knife, sword etc in order to cut someone or something
definition[3]: a line (/) used in writing to separate words, numbers, or letters
definition[4]: a long narrow cut in something
example[3]: Cut several slashes across the top of the loaf before baking.
definition[5]: to greatly reduce an amount, price etc
example[4]: Over the last year the workforce has been slashed by 50%.
example[5]: At least $400 million may be slashed from an annual budget of $2.4 billion.
